website_summaries.verdict: Roomy for its size, sturdy and nicely ventilated, this mini-ITX case allows for flexibility in drive mounting.
pros: Case’s dimensions and size make it very versatile for custom builds
cons: Can leave little breathing room after packing with components, power supply, and multiple drives
Case’s mesh creates a buzzing sound when fan is running

customer_reviews.title: Great media center, after replacing the fan.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Elite 110 with the intention of making a home media server, and it suited that use case just fine. I took a star off because the metal 'shell' that comes off for component installation is rather flimsy and prone to being bent if you're not careful. The (single) fan that came with the box was rather loud, which was quickly replaced with a nice Noctua fan. The original fan was pre-installed on the interior of the case, but I was able to fit the Noctua between the face-plate and the main frame. This saved some precious space in the main compartment.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Z

customer_reviews.title: Very nice case but...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice case. But it states you can mount a 200mm fan to the top of the case. So I bought a 200mm fan, assuming due to lack of specificity that it didn't matter. Well I have to spent several dollars to make get a few more bucks off the original purchase. So I can buy the Megaflow 200 that supposedly ACTUALLY/ONLY fits.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan D.

customer_reviews.title: Very simple installation - clean, and works great!
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted a simple case to replace a Shuttle HPC. This one is just the ticket. Of course you have to buy the motherboard and power supply, but the case is fairly open and installation was very easy. The cables have excellent labeling letting you know what goes where. The connectors were perfect for me. The case has plenty of vents and two good sized fans in the right spots. I am very impressed. It is my first Cooler Master product. Again, if you are after flashing lights and being able to see your motherboard, then this isn't for you. If you just want a sleak little rectangle that is quiet and works great, this is it!
customer_reviews.author: Muerte

customer_reviews.title: Spacer screw/grounding issues
customer_reviews.text: The case is great. Lots of space and good cable management. I had a big issue with the spacer/grounding screws. The spacer screws didn’t fit right, I had to take the screws and drive them in and out to make the holes work for the spacers and then put the spacers in. I couldn’t get them to work properly and I started having grounding issues that would shut down my computer instantly; very frustrating. I think I have a work around that seems to work but it would be nice if these smallest parts were correct.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Poorly located power supply, no filters - skip this and get a fractal
customer_reviews.text: There are a number of issues with this case. The power supply is an ATX, but it is located directly over the motherboard, severely limiting CPU cooler choices, in most cases to a small AIO water cooling solution. The power supply also protrudes over the motherboard backplate, limiting access and it looks weird. Internally the case has a strange layout that seems to be designed to maximize interference from cables. There are no dust filters and no easy way to install them if it had them. I built a similar system using a fractal case of nearly identical footprint, , and I think that case is well worth the few extra bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M.

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, poor execution
customer_reviews.text: Out from the box, the selling point - the motherboard tray is warped... The tray has two stable position - both crooked thus it never lays flat... I'd say that the tray is even more crooked than crooked Billary... well, let's not exaggerate... Oh... that sweet, sweet, cheap-cheap "made in china" lure... if only they could do the job properly...
customer_reviews.author: Popobawa

customer_reviews.title: No support
customer_reviews.text: I liked the case except the motherboard tray was warped. When I emailed Cooler Master for support I was informed they no longer manufacture this case and to contact the seller. Pity.
customer_reviews.author: K. Royal

customer_reviews.title: don't count on the front ports working properly
customer_reviews.text: Pros : - lots of airflow - lots of places for fans - I love the hot-swap bays! - holds a lot of hardware - quality metal work Cons : - front-port board/wiring is of low quality; USB 3.0 quit on me, and the unshielded AC'97 wires are triggering "New hardware found" whenever the disks spin up - despite this being a huge mother of a box, there is very little room to work in the lower half (where all the drives and power-supply live). the top half has a lot of wasted space
customer_reviews.author: hilndr44

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and spacious
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this case is good. It's made of quality material, very strong, lots of room, can fit pretty much any modern video card, and lots of air if a good cable management. The only thing I couldn't deal with was the noise. I know it didn't advertise that it was silent, but it could definitely use some noise deadening. I plan to change out the default factory fans that came with it to see if that helps. Other than the noise it's a nice case all around.
customer_reviews.author: Keon B. Billings

customer_reviews.title: Great case. I regret having to return it, it was just WAY too big.
customer_reviews.text: I must not have paid close enough attention to the dimensions, but I found a HUGE package in front of my door. I unpacked it and realized how massive this thing is. Based my reaction to its size, I almost packed it right back up for return. Instead, I spent a very long with the case and got to appreciate the thoughtfulness that went into the design. This is a really nice case! Unfortunately, I had to return it simply because it was too big to fit on any of my shelves. If I happen upon bigger shelves in the near future, I can easily see myself buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: marty marie

customer_reviews.title: It's what you want.
customer_reviews.text: All 4 side panels remove easily. The mount for the motherboard is removable for easy access. Hard drives can be removed in seconds. I suppose it does not have every bell and whistle but it has a ton of little things that add up. The reason I bought it was because I wanted to upgrade and modify without any work. The frame is very solid and I need that when I move or when I tinker. And my temps, never been so good. It looks great with my setup. I think this model may be discontinued. Get it now.
customer_reviews.author: Guyman

customer_reviews.title: Top Fan holes will not fit a 200 MM Fan without altering the top of the case.
customer_reviews.text: The case is Awesome to start with, but I just bought a 200mm Fan to put in the top, and when I got the fan the holes for the fan are not in the right place for a 200 MM fan as shown in the image. I had to remove the rubber inserts, flatten out the mesh on top and then drill new holes where the fan would get mounted.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A Henderson

customer_reviews.title: This case is BIG and may not be for everyone.
customer_reviews.text: There is enough room in this case for just about whatever you want to stuff in the thing. Built this one for a recording studio and the need for multiple cards including a large video card. Great room, very quiet, room for whatever cooling system you'd ever need. The only con other than size is the plug in drive bay on the front. Seems way too cheesy but does seem to work. Time will tell on this issue. Other than that, completely modular, removable mobo tray, plenty of slots for drives, SSD or optical. In short a good case if you have the need for the size.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Zero Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: This comes with a warranty, but you better hope you never need to use it. I love these cases, but I received a damaged one. I followed the directions to request an RMA number. They told me I would here back in 48 hours. After 2 weeks, I did it once more. Now, another week has gone by - still no response. So, if you buy, be sure to unpack and inspect it very quickly before the opportunity to return it to Amazon is gone, because you will probably not get any support from Cool Master.
customer_reviews.author: spratjack

customer_reviews.title: This is a great case!
customer_reviews.text: This case is very roomy and easy to use. The case has good airflow keeping everything pretty chilly. Love the stacked design and how it can be worked on from both sides and top. X-bay ports are very useful, they are a lot better than having a external docking station. I probably will buy this for all my builds from now on. Fore those looking for a small HTPC case look elsewhere, as this case is pretty huge and best suited for either Comfortable building, Overclockers, Gaming enthusiasts or someone that just needs really good airflow.
customer_reviews.author: T.J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Case
customer_reviews.text: One of the reasons I bought this case is the room it gives the builder. Most of the cables can be hidden under the motherboard and not seen, except as necessary. The other reason I bought this case is the high-airflow. Even though I have over-clocked my CPU my temps are well within acceptable limits, 32 - 63 degrees Celsius. The case size is not that much bigger than a normal full-sized case, but gives plenty of room for all your components.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Cooler Master
customer_reviews.text: Cooler Master,, man where was this box ten years ago. Please if you are just a USER, stop. This box is great, lots of room. plenty of space, and access points. Three panels, and you are on the insides. Easy to carry. If you can get up six drive connections, this is your new box. If your gaming system gets hot, you can get up to four fans going in here, and a tower on the CPU. My history, been doing this since 1980. This is my last box.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Silva

customer_reviews.title: Great looking case
customer_reviews.text: I really like this case, super modular and actually fun to put together. You can remove the entire mobo while it is mounted which makes it really easy to take things out or make changes. It is very quiet and has a lot of space for extra drives and plenty of space for gpus. Only down side is I have a hard time trying to find the best place to put it because of how large it is and that it's not a tower that I'm used to
customer_reviews.author: Eric Messenger

customer_reviews.title: Best Case Ever
customer_reviews.text: Seriously the *best* case ever. It's huge, has solid handles to carry it with, and easy to access interiors. Almost every side of the cube can be completely removed, as well as the grates and ports. There's "drawers" inside that you attach your computer components to, and those "drawers" plug into each other, connecting your machine together. If you need to perform maintenance on your motherboard, for example, just open the case up and take out the "drawer" your mobo is screwed onto. No case in the way! Perfect for people like me with big clumsy hands. Also has lots of space for air flow, many ports, and absolutely stylish as heck.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton Strong

customer_reviews.title: Its nice but cramped.
customer_reviews.text: The case is perfect for a nice small powerful PC like I wanted. I did have too buy an aftermarket CPU fan  that was slim so it would fit between the CPU and Power Supply.
customer_reviews.author: Yoduh

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy case but do not trust it to arrive undamaged
customer_reviews.text: Solid heavy aluminum material. Made in China. Arrived with bent motherboard tray, unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Chad G

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case, bought a second
customer_reviews.text: Nearly everything about this case is perfect. The only mild complaint would be the hot-swap SATA cases are plastic. If you're going to be inserting/removing daily, they'll wear out. Once in a while is no problem. Everything else is fantastic. Don't forget to order "Fenlink 2.5" to 3.5" Internal SSD Hard Drive SATA Drive Converter" if you're going to mount a 2.5" SSD or HDD in the SATA hot-swap caddy. It's the best adapter for this purpose. Bought the first case and liked it so much I bought a second for my nephew's rebuild.
customer_reviews.author: no comment

customer_reviews.title: Great case, easy to maintain and clean
customer_reviews.text: have been meaning to get this case for a while, it's exactly as useful as i expected. easy to maintain the motherboard with the mobo tray, lots of wire management opportunities. one thing to be careful about, if you want a top fan, you'll need to be careful of how tall your cpu cooler is, I had to skip the top fan because it was colliding with my new cooler. The case is able to be stripped basically bare if needed, so it seems like it will be super easy to clean, which was a big problem with my old cases. I'm pretty happy with this
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: The haf xb II evo is amazing. Probably a bit larger than you are thinking ...
customer_reviews.text: The haf xb II evo is amazing. Probably a bit larger than you are thinking so be aware of this. I could go on and in about this case but plenty of people have already done that. So I'll keep to the basics. Plan out your build. The motherboard will go in after you have your psu, disc drive, ssd and HDDs in place and wired up. If you do this backwards your going to have a bad time... But when they say Hugh airflow they aren't lying. Do yourself a favor and vacuum/sweep throughly before getting this setup or it will be a dust and hair magnet. Hmm okay yea that's about all I can think of.
customer_reviews.author: brian woolf

customer_reviews.title: Still a very relevant case for the people wanting small form factor.
customer_reviews.text: I would love to give this thing 5 stars. The mini GTX 1080 was a little rough. I'm running 2 nvme's on a ASUS ROG Strix Z370-I. No ssd or hdd on this rig. My problem is it doesn't take the Corsair SF Series, SF450. It takes 2 of the screws and leaves a big hole in the back. I could get a bigger PSU, but I'll wait. Pay attention to the size of your watercooler. This thing has low dimensions. I ran a Corsair H55 with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: L. Grinnell

customer_reviews.title: Nice, big box
customer_reviews.text: I love this case. I didn’t even need to add fans to it. It’s super modular, easy to work on, and allows an almost extreme level of airflow. It’s big AF though. Also, the removable motherboard tray can warp when not screwed down. Mount you motherboard loosely if you do so on the tray and tighten it down only after attaching the tray or you it deforming you’re motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Shara Vabdas

customer_reviews.title: Great Case! Great Quality! Lots of room!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Wish it was a bit smaller but still, very good quality and plenty of room! Current Build: ASUS P8H61-I R2.0 LGA 1155 Intel H61 HDMI USB 3.0 Mini ITX Intel Motherboard Intel Core i5-3470 Quad-Core Processor 3.2 GHz 4 Core LGA 1155 - BX80637I53470 Antec EarthWatts EA-380D Green 380 Watt 80 PLUS BRONZE Power Supply PNY GeForce GT 730 1GB GDDR5 Graphics Cards VCGGT7301D5LXPB Crucial Ballistix Sport 8GB Kit (4GBx2) DDR3 1600 (PC3-12800) 240-Pin UDIMM Memory BLS2KIT4G3D1609DS1S00/BLS2CP4G3D1609DS1S00 Seagate 500GB Laptop SSHD SATA 6Gb/s 64MB Cache 2.5-Inch Internal Bare Drive (ST500LM000) Kingston Digital 240GB SSDNow V300 SATA 3 2.5 (7mm height) Solid State Drive (SV300S37A/240G)
customer_reviews.author: Jon Siedlik

customer_reviews.title: Solid case with one drawback
customer_reviews.text: This is a great case, I found it pretty easy to work with and my install went pretty seamlessly. The only thing keeping this case from 5 stars is the 200mm fan spot on the top. I got a thermal take fan for it and it didn't fit. Upon further investigation it seems the slot is for a Cooler Master 200mm fan. Which is fine I guess but I was able to use some 80mm noctuas on the back under the expansion slots so I don't know why I can't do the same with the 200mm.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Very solid workstation case without bling, something that is getting hard to find.
customer_reviews.text: This case has excellent airflow, 2 x 5-1/4 bays which I used for a BD drive and a six port USB 3.0 front panel. It also has 2 x 3-1/2 hot swap bays in which a 2-1/2 ssd or hdd can be used. The motherboard tray is removable by removing 4 thumb screws and is big enough for EATX boards like Asus Crosshair or Rampage Extreme. My only issue is the two included 120mm 3 pin fans in the front that run at 1250RPM when set on silent in the bios which makes them noisey. I have some PWM fans ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tiny case
customer_reviews.text: This little case packs so much in a small area it blows me away when I first got this I was like there no way it could fit 2 hhd and a ssd but it did and i didn’t have a modular power supply but it still fit the only thing that didn’t was my graphics card I didn’t think it would I knew it was too big but one can hope very happy with this case
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unbelieveable what you can get in this thing
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Built an AMD Ryzen 1600X with a Corsair H60 liquid CPU cooler and a GeForce GTX 1050ti. Also a full size 800w modular PSU. It fit like a glove. No room left, but still plenty of air flow. There is room for two fans on the radiator for push/pull cooling. Who would have ever thought that all that would fit in this little case. I will be swapping out the 1600x for a faster CPU in the future. Screaming fast mini PC with room for the future. By the way, there is room for two SSD's and one 3.5" hard drive. Wow!
customer_reviews.author: Repro63

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for HTPC and living room gaming!
customer_reviews.text: I love the design if this case. Things are tight. I already had a power supply that was not modular so things are a bit tight. HDD mounting is a little weird, but overall this is the best case I have found for HTPC use. I have an MSI full size gtx 1080 card and a i5 8400 in here. If you plan on putting the power supply in the designated spot (aka not use an external psu) do not plan on having room for a large air cooler because it won’t fit.
customer_reviews.author: M. CARPER

customer_reviews.title: purfect box
customer_reviews.text: this is one of the best cases i have ever dealt with and am impressed with the build quality. it is also very easy to do the initial install but if you need to add power to a drive it is a little tough. this is the best bang for your buck on a gaming case that is very subdued and stays extremely cool if you load it up with all of the fans.
customer_reviews.author: benjamin champlin

customer_reviews.title: Quality control issues - May need to supply your own missing hardware.
customer_reviews.text: Came missing parts, so wonder about other quality control issues. I triple checked, but I only received 3 of the 4 standoffs needed to mount the motherboard. Granted for someone building their own rig, no big deal, but buyers beware that you may to supply your own!
customer_reviews.author: D. Hamm

customer_reviews.title: Faulty power button
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this case and was super excited once I started building the machine there were 2 pins for + and - and once I installed to mobo, I find out the power button lights up red, but when I click on it my machine doesn’t start. After a few hours of figuring out how to on the machine. I gave up and found out the power button was faulty and I was pissed. Luckily amazon is sending a free replacement 👌🏼
customer_reviews.author: Balraj Jutla

customer_reviews.title: Great little case with surprising amount of space.
customer_reviews.text: Built a new pc using this case, and I really like it. Surprising amount of space for such a small enclosure. If I build another pc in the future I'll be very tempted to go with this case again. Pros, small footprint, plenty of room for components, good air flow. Cons, (if you can call it that) limited mounting places for fans. I would definitely use a modular power supply when building in this case, the ability to limit cables to those you need helps make the case easy to manage and avoid a rat nest of unused wires.
customer_reviews.author: Turner.

customer_reviews.title: Small footprint, pay attention to your vid card width and the availability of only 2 exp. slots
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a small footprint pc case that was simple, didn't need the rgb lights as it would sit in the front of the living room in the home theater setup. Case is typical sturdiness for the price, nothing fancy. I had to return because I didn't pay attention to the width of the evga rtx 2060 XC card, it's 2.75 slots wide, this case only supports 2. Mistake on my part, otherwise I would have been perfectly happy with this case.
customer_reviews.author: William D

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little pc
customer_reviews.text: Used this to build a msi gaming pro ac intel pc. I used an EVGA 450w bronze power supply which is not fully modular. It made it cramped in the case but using the stock cooler for the low watt cpu it worked out fine. I used a nvidia gt 1030 gpu and I added two 80mm fans on the case. Temps are fine and the case is portable and epic.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Love this case!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my new gaming machine coupled with a Noctua NH-DL15 CPU cooler. Love the handles so I can move the PC upstairs to my VR gaming room. Still kind of heavy when moving but it's worth it. Takes up more space than your tower PC but I prefer a horizontal motherboard layout with a brick of a CPU cooler attached. I actually prefer a horizontal layout period. Shame they aren't made any more or a newer design taking its place.
customer_reviews.author: Dougiet27

customer_reviews.title: Open Box sold as new, missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Bought this case a couple months and finally got around to building the system. To my surprise, the box that includes the screws and hard drive sleds was missing. I had extra screws and cables that I was able to finish the system but give this 2 stars for selling me an open box item with scratches on the side and not providing me the necessary screws, cables, and hard drive sleds. I expected so much better from CoolerMaster. Lesson learned. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: gators4ever

customer_reviews.title: Has some issues
customer_reviews.text: This case has lots of cooling openings, uses a standard ATX power supply (unlike many mini-ITX small case) and is a decently small size. But it has an awkward raised area on the top that prevents stacking most anything on top of it. It also has the USB and audio jacks on the left side instead of the front. That placement prevents putting it next to anything else or the wall if you want access.
customer_reviews.author: EmbeddedFlyer

customer_reviews.title: Good case that could be the ultimate SFX case with some revisions from Cooler Master.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice case - the small size is absolutely awesome. However, I would like to see CM make a revision where you can put 80mm fans on the right side of the case (looking at the front). I very highly recommend getting an AIO liquid cooler (eg a Corsair H60) - the cables from the PSU will restrict airflow and severely limit your ability to overclock if you use an air cooler on the CPU. Also, an SFX power supply is pretty much a must-have with this case. Make sure you get an ATX to SFX bracket though, as the PSU cutout is sized to ATX.
customer_reviews.author: kingmeowser

customer_reviews.title: great case, fits inside rack enclosures perfectly, no complaints
customer_reviews.text: Great little case. Will fit inside any 6U+ rackmount enclosure. It's not 100% perfect, but almost. Needs non-screwable sidepanels and top panel (use some sort of ez-latch mechanism with handles inversed to bottom). Get rid of internal 5.25 cages completely, replace with more internal fan mounts or airflow/cabling features. Make front mesh panel completley flat and non-bezeled - will look much sleeker and high end. Move logo to plastic panel somewhere, no glued on emblems.
customer_reviews.author: H Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Great case for the price
customer_reviews.text: Of all the cases i have owned, this one is BY FAR the best one i have owned. it has alot of space and for me to be able to do cable management was a big plus as i wanted a clean case look. Everything fit in perfectly before i got a corsair h55, i had a coolermaster hyper 212 and it fit into the case well with room to spare. If your looking for a nice cube case with adequate airflow throughout the case, this is the one! with a corsair H55, i still have space to spare
customer_reviews.author: Dallas Broere

customer_reviews.title: Dope.
customer_reviews.text: Solid M-ITX Case, especially for the money. Decent size, easier to fit a lot of components in if you use an SFX power supply with an adapter. I modded mine with a handle on the top for easy carrying and expanded the graphics card side panel with 140MM fan grills for better airflow. This computer is now my daily driver.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Shoesmith

customer_reviews.title: Pride hike
customer_reviews.text: I need one more of these but when i bought my first one was only 100$ They jacked it up to 300$ refuse to buy at this price range. Looks like ill have to find a different cube design
customer_reviews.author: Buying things

customer_reviews.title: Great case, not for me but great case
customer_reviews.text: I stumbled upon this case knowing I had to resize my full ATX sized rig in hopes it would size down my desktop. While installing my already iffy motherboard had my last two ram channels give out and RMA my board probably due to my error. Returned it to switch to a MATX build however this case was still a really nice case. Footprint wise due to its cube nature it's a bit wider and more of a big box compared to a tower which might come off a lot bigger than anticipated but the case was nevertheless a wonderful case even if it wasn't for my purpose. If you're looking to build it's heavily tailored towards ease of access
customer_reviews.author: Emuu

customer_reviews.title: Excelent for small formfactor PCs
customer_reviews.text: Really great case. While it is a little difficult to work in if you have a standard PSU that isn't modular, it still works well and can even fit in my full size GTX1080 FTW-DT. One thing that I would warn though is if you do not like hearing your hard drive spin up, then this isn't the case for you, as you can clearly hear your hard drive since it is a smaller case and the drive is suspended on a thin metal platform. But if you don't mind noticing a little bit of noise, then this is a great case. I personally sit it on my desk along with the rest of my setup.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon Jones

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This item works great. Has 2 120MM dans installed - I am doing LED colors so I put in a cooler master 240 water cooler - fit great - Its a pretty good case with less sharp edges than others. Its a GO BUY.. Had a coupon and paid like $90
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Hawaii

customer_reviews.title: You won't find a more practical case.
customer_reviews.text: Rugged. Mobo sits flat....so your Graphics card doesn't sag or sit unsupported. Plenty of room to work. A water cooled 240mm radiator installs with ease. I get really low temps with my builds, using this case! I was told by "Cooler Master" that this product will be discontinued !?!? Please email cooler master and ask them to continue production. I absolutely love this 'cube'.
customer_reviews.author: StratCat

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design with many possibilites if footprint isn't an issue.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this case, yes it is fairly bulky BUT the internal space allows so much flexibility. The primary swappable HDD fixture has drive carriers the attach and detach easily without tools. It has an insane amount of fan/radiator mounting points. Plenty of room for cable or liquid cooler plumbing routes. A removable secondary HDD internal cage. It will fit on a shelf in a 19" LAN rack. The handles have bracing as part of the main chassis frame so you are not lifting by side panels themselves. If I had for a 2nd case I'd get another of these in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great Case but watch your Graphics card's width
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to build a portable gaming/media PC. It has plenty of room for long video cards. However I am having to return it because the graphics card I bought was too WIDE. The 2 slots that are used for the graphics card are right on the edge so if you pick a graphics card that is wider than the 2 slots (like a Radeon RX 5700 XT) it will not fit in the case. I would definitely buy the case again as it was really nice and the layout was awesome, I would just order a card that didn't take up so much width.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse R. Corray

customer_reviews.title: Best Case I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this case 2 years ago. Haven't regretted it since. It's some what compact design made it a little difficult for my fat hands during assembly but once done, it's gorgeous. Installed all fans with red LEDs. 2x 80mm, 3x 120mm and one top 200mm. Needless to say, it lights up the room. In another few years when it's time to upgrade components, I will not be buying a new case... The only CON I have found, the dust from the open design. I have to blow it out more often. I can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: Ranmasou

customer_reviews.title: Great flexible case
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, I purchased the Elite 130 for a Mini-ITX Computer build and it came with all the needed mounting hardware and instructions. The case is quality built, flexible in design and easy to assemble. For a small size case, it has plenty of drive mounting options to support any hardware combinations 1-5.25” ODD bay, 2-3 (counting the 5.25” if not used) 3.5” HDDs bays and 3-5 (again counting 3from the 5.25” if not used) 2.5” HDD or SSD bays. The case has excellent cooling with plenty of ventilation and it came with 2 quite fans.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Mark G

customer_reviews.title: Solid PC!
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this a few months now with a ryzen 7 2700x. Liquid cooled 280mm nzxt kraken (had to remove front fans). Plus liquid cooled 1080ti. Did install top fan to be blowing down into case to force air out. It's a little unconventional in size, but it's a pleasure when you have to move the thing. The loudest part is obviously the video card but it's a good bit quieter than my other systems.
customer_reviews.author: jared hall

customer_reviews.title: Only suitable for ryzen 3 stock small cooler
customer_reviews.text: I tough this unit could be a great option as ultra gaming machine in micro itx form factor. 1. Can handle the biggest video card. 2. Is not suitable for high performance cpu cooler even with the stock ryzen 7 is not compatible. The height block the installation of the power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos A. Lara

customer_reviews.title: Great case
customer_reviews.text: Pro's Easy to work in. I'm always a sucker for the motherboard tray. Easy to cable. Tones of fans 6 available (not all populated) Lots of space Con's Only one and i knew at purchase no USBC on the front panel
customer_reviews.author: Alyce Nunn

customer_reviews.title: Extremely versatile and very compact case, makes for an awesome HTPC
customer_reviews.text: So far I've built 2 PCs with this case and I am very pleased with its build quality and layout for the internal components. I will say that a modular power supply is highly recommended although not required in order to make a clean build. I built a simple home workstation and a fully blown out gaming C (i7 and GTX1080) and this case served well for both purposes. The gaming PC even sported a 120mm closed water cooling from Cooler Master which fit perfectly to keep the I7 processor in check. Overall great build quality and will do the job for any desktop build application
customer_reviews.author: Jose L Valle and Rosiel Ayala

customer_reviews.title: Black Cube
customer_reviews.text: Given that this is one of the smallest ATX cases you can buy, I expected it to fit in my pocket. It doesn't, of course, and it's actually wider that your typical tower, but the all black cube design makes it special in that its something different. I won't list my build, but as long as you buy mini ITX compatible components (for instance, Gigabyte LGA1151 Intel H110 Mini ITX DDR4 LGA 1151 Motherboards GA-H110N) you should be fine. It was a tight fit with the power supply cables so be ready to reorganize if needed. All in all, though, love the case.
customer_reviews.author: RyanTop Contributor: Soccer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice case for NAS box
customer_reviews.text: Got this case for a budget NAS build and it's doing great so far. It can fit three 3.5" + one 2.5" drives without a problem since I don't use the PCIe slot. It is a little cramped inside though you can get more space using an SFX PSU with an ATX adapter plate (sometimes included). This would allow a taller CPU cooler than with an ATX PSU and more room for cable management. The front fan is not loud but not silent either. Together with the PSU fan they do a very good job of cooling this case.
customer_reviews.author: REQ

customer_reviews.title: Nice Compact Bulid Case
customer_reviews.text: Simple case that was fairly easy to work in. Once the power supply is in it can be a bit tricky to maneuver around inside. However there is plenty of grill cut outs for cooling despite the compact design. I was glad to see vents in the side panel where the graphics card is taking in air without restricting it. The only negative that makes this 4.9 stars is the limited use of filters over all the cutouts besides the one over the front intake fan. Otherwise a pretty sturdy case that allows adequate cooling for the compact size.
customer_reviews.author: ArtDo9

customer_reviews.title: I love the size
customer_reviews.text: I love the size. It's tricky to work in, which is not a surprise for a mini ITX case of this size that supports a regular ATX power supply. It would be nice to have a portion of the frame on the PCIe slot side of the chassis to remove to make installation of larger GPU components easier, and an exhaust fan setup on the opposite side of the chassis for better cooling. You'll definitely want a modular power supply, and probably liquid cooling as the clearance between the CPU socket and the bottom of the power supply is pretty tight.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Shelton

customer_reviews.title: HAF XB EVO 200mm fan hole spacing
customer_reviews.text: I like the case, easy to carry and loads of expansion. The 200mm fan mounting holes on the top of the case are a major disappointment. I could get 2 screws in my Bitfenix Spectre pro rgb, but I ended up using zip ties to hold it more securely to the grate. Would have given it 5 stars if it weren't for having messed up the hole spacing for the 200mm fan.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Lee Brumage

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a case that was durable and most importantly, I wanted a test-bench style case. This is both. The sides unscrew and all panels come off to a bare-bones test bench style case. Easy access. Think your CPU Heatsink is too tall? Nope. When I pickup and move the case, nothing rattles or moves. its a solid brick. I love it and will buy again for next rig due to ease of access to internals.
customer_reviews.author: Tim B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent expandable case!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent case if you are looking for expandability and practicality. Very sturdy, with lots of space for extra drives and added IO. Very easy to work in! My only gripe with it is that it is fairly wide, so it takes up a lot of desk space, but I haven't found a vertical case that I like nearly as well, so I'll deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Fred J. K.

customer_reviews.title: Really perfect box for vertical height challenges
customer_reviews.text: It surprises me there aren't more computer cases like this. It's the only one I could find within reason for a 18in vertical bookshelf next to my desk. So much better than a tall floor model and so much room for expansion. Excellent air flow. The build quality is excellent and Cooler Master is a highly trusted brand.
customer_reviews.author: pcaugh

customer_reviews.title: Another great case from Cooler Master
customer_reviews.text: Another great case from Cooler Master. Laying down the motherboard just makes everything so much easier to place. Cable management was a breeze with this case. I fit a Cooler Master V8 GTS in and two evga 960ssc video cards with two more inchs of room for longer cards if need be.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Collects dust and gets hot quick
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent case for your build if you're looking for something portable and don't mind having to fumble with a crammed lil computer. The three fans on this case don't really keep the computer cool (especially when running any video games or programs), but they do love to collect all the dust in the room. Be sure to open up the case and clean your build of any dust frequently if you do buy this case
customer_reviews.author: S&P

customer_reviews.title: BEST CASE EVER!
customer_reviews.text: This case is the greatest case I've ever had the pleasure to own and work on. My favorite feature has to be the motherboard tray, I can't begin to tell you how handy it is. It keeps the mobo from flexing when you handle it which is great and you don't have to remove it once it's on. The case has amazing air flow. My temps have never been lower especially coming from a Corsair 600T. I love everything about it. I'll never own a tower again, they stick out like a sore thumb.
customer_reviews.author: Nk

customer_reviews.title: Best Case
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best computer case I have ever had. Computer stays cool without the fans having to work very hard which also makes it quiet. The only problem I had was that I used a third party cpu cooler that was quite big and I didn't have room for the big fan at the top of the case. No problem though because I didn't need it. I bought a second one for my brother and used the fan in his with a stock cpu cooler and it works great as well.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing. It's tiny. Went from a full ATX tower to this and I don't regret it. Stock fan that comes with it isn't PWM so you can't adjust the speed and it's kind of noisy but I planned on swapping that out any way. The 80mm I took out as well as it was not in a place that was going to benefit my cooling in any way. Like I previously stated it's tiny. Your cables are going to be tight, and if you have a big cooler on your GPU thats probably not going to fit too great either. I have a founders edition 980 and it fits great.
customer_reviews.author: Zachery Reed

customer_reviews.title: I didn't like the power button
customer_reviews.text: I also have a SilverStone SG05, I got this case for Brother. The 110 is larger then the SilverStone. The layout of the 110 makes it louder then the SG05, It can have a ATX power supply but I did a sfx power supply on bracket. It can't have a 10.5" graphics cards in it and its to wider then it need to be, I didn't like the power button. I would not buy it again. If your going small go small.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Plummer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little case
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints, I wanted a small form factor but not microscopic. I am trying to sort out some USB3 port issues but I don't think it has anything to do with the the Cooler Master parts, more likely my motherboard and/or drivers. It looks nice and tidy.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent build quality
customer_reviews.text: It considerably serves the purpose for which it was purchased. This mini-ITX case is sturdily built. It takes a full size ATX power supply; although, a semi-modular PSU is recommended. It has two USB-3 connectors on the side front panel. It has two PCI slots on the rear There is no room for a CD/DVD drive, but who needs one these days. This is my second Cooler Master mini-ITX case, and I am very happy with both of them. Excellent build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.title: Tough and tiny box, but crammed to the 9's
customer_reviews.text: Loaded it with push pull water radiator, needed to modify mid drive mount for clearance. 2700 needs it even underclocked. Hard to add floor hdd, disasseble 3rd time. Need 1TB scratch drive as 1TB M2 fills too quickly with huge files.
customer_reviews.author: H. Schulze

customer_reviews.title: Definitely the best
customer_reviews.text: After 25 years of building computers, this is the best design and error-free manufacturing. Changing hardware configuration and adding new components is as easy as on work bench. Plenty of space, no need to organize cables, all can be aligned below motherboard. Great case!
customer_reviews.author: CompuGeak

customer_reviews.title: Cable management nightmare
customer_reviews.text: this thing is hard to work with if you have longer cabling I broke the hot swap backplane trying to connect a sata cable to it overall even though its 100$ it feels cheaply made everywhere it can be, the metal is easily strippable so the thumbscrews are lose going to buy something else eventually, would of returned if I kept the box
customer_reviews.author: The Barry

customer_reviews.title: everything i could ask for in a case
customer_reviews.text: easy to build in, modular, great air flow and mounting spaces. I love the quick change slots on the front, makes installing everything such a delight. Side panels are removable, so you can get in from all angles. No point in getting RGB though, as you'll barely be able to see it though the side plates.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Fake

customer_reviews.title: easy to disassemble
customer_reviews.text: So i bought this case for use in a MINI ITX Gaming build. PROS : Cheap, Lightweight, easy to disassemble. Construction seems sturdy enough. Cons : I spent a good HOUR trying to figure out how the heck to mount my PSU in this thing. Nothing made any sense until i realized that the mounting bracket that was supposed to come with the case was not included. Now i have to figure out how to order one because the PSU is sitting outside the case.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip R Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than i thought, but great
customer_reviews.text: This case is quite a bit larger than i was expecting, but it works great. I added a rear and top fan and it cools great. front loading hard drives are easy to swap out, would make a great testing rig
customer_reviews.author: Michael C

customer_reviews.title: Great case for a Mini-ITX build
customer_reviews.text: Small size, everything that needed to fit, fit, adequate ventilation - was able to use stock CPU heatsink/fan. Worked well w/ Gigabyte mini-ITX mobo, WD black 1TB HD, Corsair 550RM modular power supply (STRONGLY recommend using a fully modular power supply, as there is not a lot of space in the box for extra, unnecessary cables), 8 GB RAM, EVGA GTX-750Ti graphic card w/ 2 GB (this card did not require a separate power cable), and ASUS optical drive. Case could have handled a couple of additional drives but you put in what you need. Would have easily have fit an SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Burt Auerbach

customer_reviews.title: Favorite
customer_reviews.text: My favorite HTPC itx case. There are smaller, but this one has good airflow and many options for mounting drives. Can fit alot in if you need it and takes full power supply. Recommend changing out the front fan with a noctua redux p12 when doing initial build. Stock fan works but gets loud fast.
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

customer_reviews.title: Great case to work in
customer_reviews.text: Easy to build a PC inside this case, easy to install both hard drives and CD drives as well as the power supply. The removable motherboard tray makes things much easier as well. Only real issue is that the front fans can be a bit of a chore to get at for removal/replacement. It also goes well with RGB lighting!
customer_reviews.author: Carter Jimmis

customer_reviews.title: One of the Easier Mini ITX Cases to Build In
customer_reviews.text: I build a bunch of basic PCs for family and I love the Mini ITX form factor for that purpose. This case has replaced the Rosewill Mini ITX case as my case of choice for how easy it is to get everywhere, how many drives it holds, and how much room there is for cable management.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Watercooling Support ... Be Very Careful ... Limited Space Above PSU!
customer_reviews.text: I just installed a CoolMaster Seidon 120 watercooling kit into this case. It's a very tight fit but it works. Due to the waterblock having right angle fittings, this pushes the tubing right up against the PSU. Tubing isn't kinked or pinched but it could have definitely used an 1" more of free space to put less pressure on the waterblock tubing. Be very careful what watercooling kit you buy ... may not fit this case once you go trying to install your PSU! The 120mm fan up front makes installing a radiator a breeze plus there's plenty of room to spare behind it. Even enough room for a push-pull radiator fan setup!
customer_reviews.author: Weaver Cattle Company

customer_reviews.title: Sata Broke on Install
customer_reviews.text: I like it but the sata port broke when I tried to install. I didn't He-Man the thing in. I had plugged it it and the bend of the cord was strong enough to brake the quick swap sata port when I put the motherboard down on it. It's frustrating because now I can only used one of the quick swap drives. I still like the case, I don't wish that one piece was designed better.
customer_reviews.author: katie jones

customer_reviews.title: Oh man. I insisted on a mini-ITX setup for ...
customer_reviews.text: Oh man. I insisted on a mini-ITX setup for my new build because I needed it to be easier to move. This case fit a Corsair H60, two 3.5" hard drives, AND an EVGA GeForce GTX 1080 Ti SC. Talk about efficient use of space.
customer_reviews.author: spitfirejunky

customer_reviews.title: It's black and there is enough room, even for a regular size power supply.
customer_reviews.text: I like it, I really do. Probably would have liked it in white, but black is okay. They make an Elite 120 in white as well as black that looks about the same. I had to disassemble mine a few times because you forget various cables and whatnot as you build. But that's par for the course. In the end, I built a very functional computer with this case.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Turner

customer_reviews.title: A fantasic computer case.
customer_reviews.text: Simply I love it. The removable main-board tray is fantastic for changing out the main-board if you need to. Plenty of room inside. I really love the hot swap Hard drive slots. The fact that you can take it apart down to the bare frame is great. Running the Power and Sata cable to the Hard drives was a little difficult. I also would have liked a 3.5 cutout faceplate insert for the 5.25 drive bay.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Peters

customer_reviews.title: A great case at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: The way the case disassembles for installation makes putting the MOBO and components much simpler than a tower or pizza box. Lots of ventilation and the stock fans are very quiet. The only thing that doesn't fit perfectly was my aftermarket multi-card reader and I am able to use it in one of the removable media bays. The square shape is different so a standard desk might not accommodate it, but if you're putting it on top of the desk or beside your media center, it will look great.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Cloninger

customer_reviews.title: Very nice mini-ITX case
customer_reviews.text: Good, not amazing, case. Well built. Nice selection of front ports (including USB 3.0). No sharp edges (this is a concern with many cheap cases...I've drawn blood more than once on sharp edges of other cases). Fit and finish is just fine. Power button is a little weird...presses differently than any other case I've ever used. Not necessarily a bad thing, but it is different. In short: Case is well built, reasonably laid out, fit and finish are just fine. Nothing amazing, or awesome, or dramatically special about it, so no 5 stars. But, a very workable, nice case for a mini-ITX motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great ITX
customer_reviews.text: For a smallish case, you can fit a lot inside and still have adequate cooling. Iike Cooler Masters case layout and ability to configure specifically to your set up.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Amazing how much you can fit inside
customer_reviews.text: Amazing how much you can fit inside. I got a full size MB, 120mm CPU cooler, GTX 1080, 2 HHD, 2 SSD, and 4 120mm fans. Still room for another 2-3 drives and an optical drive. Very easy to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Great for Compact mini itx PC with full size power supply...
customer_reviews.text: Great for applications where space is an issue. Being able to get a full size gaming graphics card in the case is nice, but be aware that a power supply capable of running even a modestly powered graphics card is going to have cables that are too long/bulky and will block air flow for cooling. Realistically, a cheap 350 to 400 watt power supply with short cables and an Nvidia GeForce GTX 750ti is going to be to be about the maximum practical limit of this as a gaming PC (I only mention this because of the three fan "monster" graphics card that is pictured in the ad).
customer_reviews.author: TechGuy

customer_reviews.title: Everything is great besides the drive bay pcb board
customer_reviews.text: The reason I am giving this case 3 stars is because the pcb board that is mean for the two hard drive bays in the front. It just died on me and wont detect my drives in those two front bays, which is very frustrating. The pcb board is also awfully close to the power supply cables, meaning the cables are putting pressure against the board (most likely the cause of failure for my board). Other than that the case ia great!
customer_reviews.author: Abstract

customer_reviews.title: Perfect except for noisy included fan
customer_reviews.text: Excellent ITX case, smaller than most other ITX boxes that hold a full ATX power supply. One star taken off because the front fan that came with mine makes an annoying buzzing noise. The included fan won't be too much of a problem if you get an AIO cooler with a fan included, which is probably the best way to cool a hot CPU in this case. It's not an intended feature of the case, but I was actually able to install additional fans on the side and top vents using rubber fan mounts.
customer_reviews.author: o. t.

customer_reviews.title: Great case for testing and benching
customer_reviews.text: Nice size case with nifty features. Its bigger than what the image shows so check the dimensions and have a spot picked out first. Top and sides come off for easy benching. Only issue I had was running the cables. The bottom has limited room and my hands had a hard time fitting. I would highly recommend a modular power supply.
customer_reviews.author: spicytwinkie

customer_reviews.title: low cpu cooler clearance, loud case fan
customer_reviews.text: The clearance for the cpu cooler is only ~ 3.5 in, and is barely compatible with an amd spire cooler, leaving only half a cm of room between the top of the cooler and the psu. This works, but is bad for airflow. Thankfully, the top of the spire is removable, giving an extra cm or so of room. The included case fan was crazy loud.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron F.

customer_reviews.title: A Truly Unique Case
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this case because it seemed to be a perfect fit for my needs. As an enthusiast who changes parts often I wanted something that was going to be easy to get into and work on but also something easy to move and decent airflow. This fits the bill perfectly! My only complaint is that the industrial style is getting a bit "late 00s" now, but that is purely my opinion and obviously I knew it before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Space is tight and 5.25 bay cover must be removed for DVD
customer_reviews.text: I guess "Space is tight" should be obvious, although I'd never installed a mini-ITX MB before (last time I built a machine, you still had to set jumpers for Cyrix processors). There is a horizontal bar above the MB that allows you to drape the cables over -- very nice for keeping cables out of the fans. The build quality seems nice for a case and it looks cool enough without being toy-ish. I guess I was hoping the 5.25 bay cover would be there when there was a DVD drive installed (more like a door). The power supply isn't centered in the back, so adding a PSU with an LED makes it look lop-sided.
customer_reviews.author: RP

product_meta.title: Cooler Master Elite 110 RC-110-KKN2 Midnight Black Steel/Plastic Mini-ITX Tower Computer Case
product_meta.description: Size:Mini-ITX| Style:Elite 110Small in size. Big on performance. Elite 110 is built with an intelligent use of internal space. It can support the latest Mini ITX motherboards and graphics cards (up to 8. 3" Long) while still supporting full sized power supplies up to 180mm long and three HDDs or four SSDs. Add that it includes the ability to support 120mm water cooling radiators and you have the ability to create a space efficient, water cooled, and gaming grade PC waiting to be setup to run the latest Windows or steam OS games.
feature_bullets: Mesh front panel provides excellent front to back airflow
Supports standard size ATX power supplies up to 180mm long
Supports a 120 millimeter water cooling system in the front
Fits up to 8. 3" Long Graphics cards
Perfect size for HTPC, Steam box, or compact gaming builds
Store up to 3 HDDs/4 SSDs (HDD x3 or HDD x2 + SSD x2 or HDD x1 + SSD x3 or SSD x4)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,773 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
